1.text: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

2.text: Shall he that contends with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproves God, let him answer it.

3.text: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

4.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer you? I will lay my hand on my mouth.

5.text: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yes, twice; but I will proceed no further.

6.text: Then answered the LORD to Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

7.text: Gird up your loins now like a man: I will demand of you, and declare you to me.

8.text: Will you also cancel my judgment? will you condemn me, that you may be righteous?

9.text: Have you an arm like God? or can you thunder with a voice like him?

10.text: Deck yourself now with majesty and excellency; and array yourself with glory and beauty.

11.text: Cast abroad the rage of your wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

12.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

14.text: Then will I also confess to you that your own right hand can save you.

15.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with you; he eats grass as an ox.

16.text: See now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

17.text: He moves his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

18.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

19.text: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach to him.

20.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

21.text: He lies under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

22.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

23.text: Behold, he drinks up a river, and hastens not: he trusts that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

24.text: He takes it with his eyes: his nose pierces through snares.
